revised_title: Solid Particle Erosion of Metals: Modeling the Ploughing Component
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the erosion of metal surfaces by the impact of abrasive particles, specifically focusing on the ploughing component. They used spherical steel projectiles to simulate the erosion process and found that the physical process of metal removal is unaffected by scaling over a range of particle sizes and material densities. This research provides a basis for understanding and reducing wear in machinery and improving erosion as a tool.
